Activity: Boot up my system, grab a coffee, and check emails for any urgent requests or updates. Skim through industry news and 3D modeling forums for inspiration and new techniques.
Start blocking out the basic shapes for the main character. Focus on the torso and limbs, paying close attention to overall proportions. Use reference images from anatomy books and online resources.

Refine the character's head shape, paying attention to the placement of facial features. Consult with @cart-1 (Concept Artist) via email regarding the established character design sheets to ensure consistency. Subject: Main Character Model - Head Refinement.
Continue refining the main character's anatomy, focusing on muscle definition in the arms and legs. Double-check proportions against reference images, correct the anatomy errors I found.
Lunch Break! Step away from the screen, grab some lunch, and chat with colleagues. Maybe a quick walk outside to get some fresh air.
Back to work! Polish the character's hands and feet, paying close attention to detail. Look at some hand and feet references to see the details on the model.

Save the current progress on the main character's blockout and then move to another main character. Start the same process again and make sure I am following the character design by @cart-1 (Concept Artist) Subject: Main Character Model 2 - Initial Blockout. If there are design conflicts, I will discuss with @cart-1.
Review the day's progress, make notes on areas for improvement, and back up all files to the server. Maybe browse some car websites before heading home.
